name.text: Finding the Area of a Circular Segment

questiontext.text:
A circular park has a radius of \({@radius@}\,\text{cm}\). A walking path cuts across the park, forming a chord that subtends an angle of \({@theta_deg@}^\circ\) at the centre of the circle, as shown in the figure below.

[[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [-2, 7, 7, -2], axis:false, showCopyright: false, showNavigation: false }); var r = 4; // radius in cm var angle = 108; // degrees var theta = angle * Math.PI / 180; // radians // Center at (2,2) var O = board.create('point', [2,2], {fixed:true, visible:false}); // Endpoints of sector var A = board.create('point', [2 + r, 2], {fixed:true, visible:false}); var B = board.create('point', [2 + r*Math.cos(theta), 2 + r*Math.sin(theta)], {fixed:true, visible:false}); // Draw full circle board.create('circle', [O, A], {strokeColor:'#e51d6a', strokeWidth:3}); // Draw sector (polygon for fill) var sectorPoints = [O]; var n = 40; for(var i=0;i<=n;i++) { var t = i/n*theta; sectorPoints.push( board.create('point', [ 2 + r*Math.cos(t), 2 + r*Math.sin(t) ], {visible: false}) ); } var sectorPoly = board.create('polygon', sectorPoints, { fillColor:'#f9a', fillOpacity:0.5, borders: {visible:false} }); // Draw triangle from center var triangle = board.create('polygon', [O, A, B], { fillColor:'#f9a', fillOpacity:0.8, borders: {strokeColor:'#e51d6a', strokeWidth:2} }); // Create chord between A and B (segment boundary of the segment) board.create('segment', [A,B], {strokeColor:'#e51d6a', strokeWidth:2}); // Polygon for yellow segment area (between chord and arc) var segmentPoints = [A, B]; for(var i=n;i>=0;i--) { var t = i/n*theta; segmentPoints.push( board.create('point', [ 2 + r*Math.cos(t), 2 + r*Math.sin(t) ], {visible: false}) ); } board.create('polygon', segmentPoints, { fillColor:'yellow', fillOpacity:0.7, borders: {visible: false} }); // Dimension label (radius) board.create('text', [ (O.X()+A.X())/2-0.5, (O.Y()+A.Y())/2.8, "{#radius#} cm"], {fontSize:18 }); // Angle label at center board.create('text', [O.X()+0.3, O.Y()+0.4, "{#theta_deg#}°"], {fontSize:18 }); [[/jsxgraph]]

Calculate the area of the circular segment formed by the walking path \(\text{Correct to 4 s.f}\).

\(\text{Area of the Circular segment}=\)[[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{cm}^2\)[[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
To find the area of the segment, first find the area of the triangle and then subtract it from the area of the sector.

Area of a sector

Recall:
\(\text{Area of a sector}=\frac{\theta}{360} \times \pi r^2\)
Therefore,
\(\begin{align} A&=\frac{{@theta_deg@}}{360} \times \frac{22}{7} \times {@radius@}^2 \\ &=\frac{{@theta_deg@}}{360} \times \frac{22}{7} \times {@R@}^2 \\ &={@area_sector@} \\ &={@Area_sector@}\,\text{cm}^2 \end{align} \)

Area of a triangle

Similarly, recall:
\(A=\frac{1}{2} a b \sin \, \theta\)
Where \(a={@radius@} \,\text{cm}\) and \(b={@radius@}\,\text{cm}\)
Therefore,
\( \begin{align} A&=\frac{1}{2} \times {@radius@} \times {@radius@} \times \sin\,{@theta_deg@}^\circ\\ &=\frac{1}{2} \times {@R@}^2 \times \sin\,{@theta_deg@}^\circ\\ &={@area_triangle@} \\ &={@Area_triangle@}\,\text{cm}^2 \end{align} \)

Therefore,
\( \begin{align} \text{Area of a segment}&={@Area_sector@}\,\text{cm}^2 - {@Area_triangle@}\,\text{cm}^2 \\ &={@area_segment@} \\ &={@Area_segment@}\,\text{cm}^2 \end{align} \)

questionnote.text:
\(\text{Radius of the circular park}={@radius@}\,\text{cm}\)

\(\text{Angle subtended}={@theta_deg @}^\circ\)

\(\text{Area of the circular segment formed by the walking path.}={@Area_segment@}\,\text{cm}^2\)
